column1:
3.15.5	
Summary of evidence and recommendations for the diagnosis and treatment of GUTB

Do not use antibiotic prophylaxis to reduce the rate of symptomatic urinary infection 
following: 
• 
urodynamics;
• 
cystoscopy;
• 
extracorporeal shockwave lithotripsy.

Use antibiotic prophylaxis to reduce rate of symptomatic urinary infection following 
ureteroscopy.

Use single dose antibiotic prophylaxis to reduce the rate of clinical urinary infection 
following percutaneous nephrolithotomy.
